result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel Norman Trudeau was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: and follow through with any recommendations.

Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: 215 days jail, 186 days stayed pending successful completion of probation, 29 days jail to be served with good time and credit.. 1st 48 hours to commence immediately, remaining days to be served on EHM.
Allowed after 1st 48 hours. Court's authorization for EHM is subject to the Sheriff's approval, policies, and procedures.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Norman Trudeau

defendant.name: Trudeau, Daniel Norman
defendant.address: 11150 20th St. Ct. N, Lake Elmo, MN 55042

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

3:34 PM Defendant Daniel Norman Trudeau in court.  Attorney Kenneth Charles Pletcher in court for Daniel Norman Trudeau.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Schieffer: guilty to Ct#1, dismiss Ct#2 and 22TR136. Test .185 w/ 2 year probation: 215 days jail, 186 days stayed, 29 days to serve w/1st 48 hours without EHM- commence immediately, $2197 fine. AODA F/T, 36 months revocation of DL, 1 year IID. Atty Pletcher and Defendant agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 22CF13. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court questions length of revocation.  Court finds Defendant guilty of Ct#1 in 22CF13. Dismisses Ct#2 in 22CF13 and 22TR136. ADA Schieffer and Atty Pletcher address sentencing. Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#1- 215 days jail w/186 days stayed pending completion of probation, 29 days (2 days credit and with good time) to serve w/1st 48 hours without EHM, remaining time on EHM(Court's authorization for EHM is subject to the Sheriff's approval, policies, and procedures) started on Thursday, October 13, 2022 at 10:00am, AODA and F/T, $2197 fine, 36 month revocation of DL w/credit for any administrative suspension, 1 year IID, Provide DNA sample within 30 days. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Defendant remanded into custody 3:57

9:34 AM Defendant Daniel Norman Trudeau not in court.  Attorney Kenneth Charles Pletcher in court for Daniel Norman Trudeau.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF13 and 22TR136. Court: prior to going on the record, Counsel requested a plea date. Court sets plea.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
filed by ADA Joseph Schieffer. eif
Pre-trial conference on July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. 22TR136 to follow. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 10:22 am.
filed by ADA Joseph Schieffer. eif

10:02 AM Defendant Daniel Norman Trudeau appears in Court, Atty Kenneth Charles Pletcher, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF13 (PH) and 22TR136 (STC).  Dep. Kale Huppert. S/T. ADA Schieffer questions Dep. Huppert. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Pletcher. ADA Schieffer is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over, Atty Pletcher argues.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from Ct Comm Gavic to Atty Pletcher's letter "Request has been granted. JRG"
from Atty Pletcher requesting the preliminary hearing set on 4/21 at 130 be rescheduled due to Mr. Trudeau being in residential treatment. ADA Schieffer does not object.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
from Ct Comm Gavic to Atty Pletcher's letter " There being no objection by the state, the preliminary hearing may be rescheduled. JRG"
from Atty Pletcher  re: requesting the preliminary hearing be rescheduled. ADA Schieffer does not object.

Def from PCJ

3:56 PM Defendant Daniel Norman Trudeau appears from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson appears by phone, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF13 and 22TR136. DE plans to retain counsel. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DA Hatch is requesting a $2,500.0 SIBS w/conditions of AS, NTO & NTE, no objection. Court so orders. Court confirms address and phone number.  DE enters NG on 22TR136. Court adjourned at 4:05 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
